meanings.definition: A single sheet of glass in a window or door.
meanings.sent1: The sun shone through the panes of the window.
meanings.sent2: She carefully cleaned the dusty panes of the old window.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat pawed at the panes, trying to catch a glimpse of the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes reflected the world outside like panes of glass.
meanings.sent5: The delicate panes of the stained glass window cast colorful patterns on the floor.

meanings.definition: A distinct section or compartment, as in a window or door.
meanings.sent1: The top pane of the window was cracked and needed replacement.
meanings.sent2: Each pane of the door had a different design etched into it.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek, peeking out from behind the panes of the fence.
meanings.sent4: His mind was divided into different panes, each holding a separate memory.
meanings.sent5: The shop displayed various cakes behind the glass panes of the counter.

meanings.definition: To cover or fill with panes.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pane the entire wall with mirrors to make the room look bigger.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully paneled the ceiling with decorative panes of glass.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to pane the cake with edible flowers for a special touch.
meanings.sent4: The gardeners planned to pane the greenhouse with clear glass to let in maximum sunlight.
meanings.sent5: He hoped to pane the artwork with a protective layer to preserve it for years to come.
